intro: Manulea decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive manulea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, berry-like fruits that contain the seeds. Manulea decipiens is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
